intro: Timonius scaber, commonly known as the rough timonius, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Timonius scaber is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various climates.
